item.title: Report X-2024080104
item.description:
Report X-2024080104

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-14T15:13:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-29
  • City: SOMERVILLE
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH AND SOUNDED LIKE DRY ICE ROLLING AROUND IN THE BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 22 POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING A WRAPPED ITEM DESTINED TO A TAXIDERMY LOCATION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER GG8335, THE UPS STORE, 519 SOMERVILLE AVE, SOMERVILLE MA 02143-3347.

item.title: Report E-2024080116
item.description:
Report E-2024080116

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-04
  • City: NORTON
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EQ NORTHEAST, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Material was picked up at shipper's location in morning, no evidence of any leak at that time. At 2nd stop of the day driver conducted regular inspection of lading and noticed small amount of liquid atop IBC, not leaking to floor of truck. Driver took precaution of tightening ring bolt further. At 3rd and final stop of this day no evidence of further leaking. Immediately after this incident we reached out to IBC manufacturer to inquire about different gaskets that may be better suited for package/lading. They sent a representative to our facility on 6/20/24 and it was determined the gaskets were appropriate for shipment. What was discovered was that manufacturer's original closure instructions has been changed since purchase of this container. Original instructions were 30 ft/lbs torque on closures. This was updated after the fact to 40 ft/lbs. We had a subsequent and very similar leak on 6/18/24 (before manufacturer rep arrived and updated instructions), see follow on report on this event.
